text: Dilation and Curettage (D&C;) is a type of surgery used to diagnose and treat problems with woman's uterus. During a D&C;, a doctor will do these things: * Give the woman anesthesia * Slowly dilate (widen) the cervix * Put a curette (a spoon-shaped tool with a sharp edge) into the uterus through the cervix * Use the curette to take out parts of the lining of the uterus. A D&C; can be used for many reasons. For example: * To take tumors out of the uterus * To diagnose problems like cancer of the uterus * To take out tissues from a fetus or placenta, after a miscarriage or a medical abortion, which will stop bleeding ==References== Category:Surgery Category:Female reproductive system
title: Dilation and curettage
